intro: Laserpitium siler subsp. laeve, commonly known as smooth siler, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and compound leaves that are typically smooth and glabrous. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, which are typical of the carrot family. It is native to Europe and parts of western Asia, often found in meadows and woodland edges. Due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
